questions.question: What is the most important water quality parameter for aquaculture?
What is the ideal pH range for most aquaculture species?
Which nitrogen compound is highly toxic to fish at low concentrations?
What is the definition of carrying capacity in aquaculture?
choices: The maximum amount of feed a system can handle
The maximum population size that an environment can sustain indefinitely
The maximum water flow rate in a system
The maximum number of species that can coexist in a system
questions.answer: The maximum population size that an environment can sustain indefinitely

questions.question: What does assimilative capacity refer to in aquaculture?
choices: The ability of fish to absorb nutrients
The ability of a water body to purify itself, removing pollutants
The capacity of a system to produce fish
The ability of bacteria to convert ammonia to nitrate
questions.answer: The ability of a water body to purify itself, removing pollutants

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common method for treating aquaculture effluents?
What is eutrophication?
choices: The process of adding nutrients to water
The excessive richness of nutrients in a body of water
The removal of nutrients from water
The balance of nutrients in an ecosystem
questions.answer: The excessive richness of nutrients in a body of water

questions.question: What is the primary source of ammonia in aquaculture systems?
choices: Fish waste and decomposing organic matter
questions.answer: Fish waste and decomposing organic matter

questions.question: Which of the following factors does NOT affect dissolved oxygen levels in water?
What is the ideal range for un-ionized ammonia in aquaculture systems?
What is the primary advantage of recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS)?
Which of the following is a sustainable practice in aquaculture water quality management?
What is the primary function of biological filtration in aquaculture?
choices: Convert ammonia to less toxic forms
questions.answer: Convert ammonia to less toxic forms

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a factor affecting carrying capacity in aquaculture?
What is the main environmental concern associated with excessive nutrient discharge from aquaculture?
Which water quality parameter is most affected by CO2 levels in aquaculture systems?
What is the primary function of sedimentation ponds in aquaculture effluent treatment?
Which of the following is a benefit of constructed wetlands in aquaculture?
What is the main advantage of optimizing feed management in aquaculture?
Which of the following is NOT a common method for monitoring water quality in aquaculture?
What is the primary role of nitrifying bacteria in aquaculture systems?
Which of the following is a potential consequence of low dissolved oxygen levels in aquaculture?
What is the main purpose of regular water quality monitoring in aquaculture?
choices: To identify and address issues early
questions.answer: To identify and address issues early

questions.question: Which of the following factors does NOT typically affect the assimilative capacity of a water body?
What is the primary advantage of integrated multi-trophic aquaculture systems?
choices: Reduced need for water quality monitoring

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common water-efficient practice in aquaculture?
What is the main concern with high nitrate levels in aquaculture systems?
Which of the following best describes the nitrogen cycle in aquaculture?
What is the primary goal of effluent management in aquaculture?
Which of the following is NOT a typical consequence of poor water quality management in aquaculture?
